activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theresa M Lamay

defendant.name: Lamay, Theresa M
defendant.address: 1411 Veterans Dr., Lot 33, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
2:12 PM 2021CF000114, 2021CF000130, 2021CF000131, 2022CF000141- Defendant Theresa M Lamay in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Theresa M Lamay.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. 

2022CF000141 - TL has received the complaint.  Attorney Erickson has also received the criminal complaint. Max penalties stated. Attorney Erickson speaks about sobriety court in Richland Center and the cash bond. TL waives the time limits to a preliminary hearing and states that she has $1,000 cash. Attorney Erickson speaks about bond and asks for a lower cash bond. Attorney Harper objects to lowering the $10,000 cash bond and speaks about TL record. Court will not amend the cash bond. 

03:21 PM Same appearances. Attorney Erickson states that TL would like to waive time limits in 22CF141. Court accepts the waiver of time limits.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
DOB Correction and Address is different from the original

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

11:25 AM Defendant Theresa Lamay in court. Attorney Harper appears for the state. Attorney Erickson appears by zoom for the defendant. (special appearance) 

State speaks about open cases and asks for a $10,000 cash bond. 
Condition: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Attorney Erickson heard.

Court orders:
$10,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on  reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Initial scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
